required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extension to the MAGNIFY MS Trial on Mavenclad® (Magnify MS Extension)
clinical_study.official_title: A 2-year Extension Study to Evaluate Long-term Effectiveness of Mavenclad® in Participants Who Have Completed Trial MS700568_0022 (MAGNIFY MS) (Magnify MS Extension)

lead_sponsor.agency: Merck Healthcare KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany, an affiliate of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany

clinical_study.source: Merck Healthcare KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany, an affiliate of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to evaluate the long-term effectiveness of Mavenclad® tablets, in terms of disease activity and safety, in participants with highly-active relapsing multiple sclerosis (RMS) previously participating in the MAGNIFY MS trial MS700568_0022 (NCT03364036).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Open label, single arm, exploratory, multicenter, 2-year, Phase IV extension study.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with No Evidence of Disease Activity (Three Parameter [NEDA-3]) During Year 3 to 4
primary_outcome.time_frame: Year 3 to 4 after the initial dose of Mavenclad® tablets in parent study
primary_outcome.description: NEDA 3: no clinical relapse, no Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) activity, no disability progression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with No Evidence of Disease Activity (Three Parameter [NEDA-3]) at Year 3 and 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Year 3 and 4 after the initial dose of Mavenclad® tablets in parent study
secondary_outcome.description: NEDA 3: no clinical relapse, no Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) activity, no disability progression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with No Evidence of Disease Activity (Three Parameter [NEDA-3]) After the Onset of Action of Mavenclad® Treatment During the Parent Study until the End of Year 3 and 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After the initial dose of Mavenclad® tablets in parent study until the end of Year 3 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: NEDA 3: no clinical relapse, no Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) activity, no disability progression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Remaining Three Parameter No Evidence of Disease Activity (NEDA-3) During Year 3 or 4 among those with NEDA-3 During Year 1 or 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Year 3 and 4 after the initial dose of Mavenclad® tablets in parent study
secondary_outcome.description: NEDA 3: no clinical relapse, no Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) activity, no disability progression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Disease Activity at Year 3 and 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Year 3 and 4 after the initial dose of Mavenclad® tablets in parent study

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Disease Activity During up to 4 Years
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial dose of Mavenclad® tablets in parent study until the end of extension study (approximately 4 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First New or Enlarging T2 Lesion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial dose of Mavenclad® tables in parent study until the end of extension study (approximately 4 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First New T1 Gadolinium Enhancing (Gd+) Lesion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial dose of Mavenclad® tables in parent study until the end of extension study (approximately 4 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Confirmed Disability Progression (CDP) as measured by Expanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial dose of Mavenclad® tables in parent study until the end of extension study (approximately 4 years)
From the initial dose of Mavenclad® tables in parent study until the end of extension study (approximately 4 years)
From the initial dose of Mavenclad® tables in parent study until the end of extension study (approximately 4 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Treatment Start with Other Disease Modifying Drugs (DMDs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial dose of Mavenclad® tables in parent study until the end of extension study (approximately 4 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from Extension Study Baseline to First New or Enlarging T2 Lesion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from Baseline (extension study), up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from Extension Study Baseline to First New T1 Gadolinium Enhancing (Gd+) Lesion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from Baseline (extension study), up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from Extension Study Baseline to First Confirmed Disability Progression (CDP), as measured by Expanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from Baseline (extension study), up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from Extension Study Baseline to First Qualifying Relapse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from Baseline (extension study), up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from Extension Study Baseline to Second Qualifying Relapse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from Baseline (extension study), up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from Extension Study Baseline to Treatment Start with Other Disease Modifying Drugs (DMDs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from Baseline (extension study), up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Year 3 and 4 after the initial dose of Mavenclad® tablets in parent study

intervention.description: No intervention will be administered as a part of this study. Participants who had received Mavenclad® up to 2 years (Year 1 and 2) in the parent study MS700568_0022 (NCT03364036) will be enrolled into this extension study and will be assessed up to 2 years follow-up (Year 3 and 4).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants of the MAGNIFY Multiple Sclerosis (MS) trial who received at least a single dose of cladribine tablets during the MAGNIFY MS trial and data on Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is available/acquired from at least parent study Month 18 or Month 24 visit and Expanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS) and relapse from parent study Month 24 visit
- Capable of giving signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant is considered by the Investigator, for any reason, to be an unsuitable candidate for the study
- Participation in other studies/trials

patient_data.ipd_description: Per company policy, following approval of a new product or a new indication for an approved product in both the EU and the US, Merck Healthcare KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany, an affiliate of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany will share study protocols, anonymized patient level and study level data and redacted clinical study reports from clinical trials in patients with qualified scientific and medical researchers, upon request, as necessary for conducting legitimate research. Further information on how to request data can be found on our website https://www.merckgroup.com/en/research/our-approach-to-research-and-development/healthcare/clinical-trials/commitment-responsible-data-sharing.html
